channel.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
channel.description:
Hello i'm about to portforward on my Netgear router. I've done this before i'm at the correct place im sure of that and i just need these questions answered so i dont mess it up.
service name- service type- start port- end port- server ip adress-
please help with ones like serive type and end port and server ip i dont think service name matters does it? thank you

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @veikron veikron
item.description:
@veikron wrote:

netgear ive done this once 4 and it worked i know about going to 192.168.1.1 in the url or w/e then you port forward from there

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @IconsOfEvil IconsOfEvil
item.description:
@IconsOfEvil wrote:

Ipv4 is your Ip Address for your computer.
Now, What router do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @veikron veikron
item.description:
@veikron wrote:

i am using vista and when i type in ipconfig it doesnt tell me so could one of u get on msn maybe with me for some help cuzi didnt get portforwarding to work -----ihatemsn221@msn.com[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 23, 2009, 12:28:55 pm[/size][hr]is it my ipv4 adress or my default gateway when i type in ipconfig?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

To find your internal IP, open up command and type in “ipconfig” (no quotes) and you’ll see 192.169.1.X … that X is the blank.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @IconsOfEvil IconsOfEvil
item.description:
@IconsOfEvil wrote:

Ipchicken gives you your internet IP not your computer.

Anyways, Are you using XP or Vista?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“veikron, post:7, topic:297170”]haha rofl my bad i rally screwed up sorry wildfire
service type only has 3 options tcp/udp, tcp, udp[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 23, 2009, 10:24:33 am[/size][hr]now for the server ip adress it already has in 192.168.1.blank this number is my number on my router i think its a netgear thing and im not sure what the blank is i think it might be one though cuz that would be number on my router[/quote] ok, service type is only TCP. go to ipchicken.com for your ip

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

Service name can be anything to help you remember what is using that port. You could use ‘MoparScape’, or your server name. Service type would probably be, as said above, internet. I’ve not used a NetGear router before, but it’s basically all the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Basic answers to portforward
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

I’ll try my best.
service name-your internet provider im guessing?*
service type-internet*
start port-43594
end port-43594
server ip adress- go to start>run>and type in cmd then press enter. then type in “ipconfig” (no quotes) and then it says ur id adress. put that in the server ip adress.

  • = not sure

Read full topic
